UiGroups.Label: Taskbar search style
UiGroups.ToolTip: This setting allows you to customize the appearance of the search box on the taskbar.

UiGroups.Label: Show taskbar apps on
UiGroups.ToolTip: This setting allows you to choose where taskbar app buttons are shown when using multiple monitors.

Values.Label: Main taskbar and taskbar where window is open

UiGroups.Label: Combine taskbar buttons on the main display
UiGroups.ToolTip: This setting allows you to choose how taskbar buttons are combined on the main display.

UiGroups.Label: Combine taskbar buttons on secondary displays
UiGroups.ToolTip: This setting allows you to choose how taskbar buttons are combined on secondary displays.

UiGroups.Label: Remove pinned apps from the start menu
UiGroups.ToolTip: This setting allows you to quickly remove all pinned apps from the start menu.

UiGroups.Label: Open File Explorer to
UiGroups.ToolTip: This setting allows you to choose the default location that File Explorer opens to.

UiGroups.Label: Show tabs from apps when snapping or pressing Alt+Tab
UiGroups.ToolTip: This setting allows you to choose whether to show tabs from apps (such as Edge browser tabs) when snapping windows or pressing Alt+Tab.

Features.Label: Remove the apps specified in the 'Apps' parameter
The selection of apps to remove, specified as a comma separated list. Use 'Default' (or omit) to use the default apps list
Remove custom selection of apps
Remove the Mail, Calendar, and People apps
Remove the new Outlook for Windows app
Remove the Xbox App and Xbox Gamebar
Remove HP OEM applications
Create a system restore point
telemetry, tracking & targeted ads
Features.ToolTip: This setting disables telemetry, diagnostic data collection, activity history, app-launch tracking, targeted ads and more. It limits the data that is sent to Microsoft about your device and usage.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling telemetry, diagnostic data, activity history, app-launch tracking and targeted ads...

Features.Label: tips, tricks & suggested content throughout Windows
Features.ToolTip: This setting removes many annoying distractions from Windows.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling tips, tricks, suggestions and ads throughout Windows...

Features.Label: Windows location services & app location access
Features.ToolTip: This will turn off Windows Location Services and deny apps access to your location. This feature uses policies, some settings will be locked.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling Windows location services and app location access...

Features.Label: local Windows Search history
Features.ToolTip: This setting disables local search history in Windows Search. This does not affect web search history or the search history saved in Microsoft Edge.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling search history...

Features.Label: tips & tricks on the lock screen
Features.ToolTip: This will turn off the tips, tricks and fun facts that appear on the lock screen.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling tips & tricks on the lock screen...

Features.Label: Windows Spotlight for desktop
Features.ToolTip: This will turn off the 'Windows Spotlight' feature for the desktop background, which shows different background images and occasionally tips and fun facts on the desktop.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling the 'Windows Spotlight' desktop background option...

Features.Label: ads, suggestions and newsfeed in Edge
Features.ToolTip: This will turn off various distractions from Microsoft Edge such as ads, suggestions and the MSN news feed. This feature uses policies, some settings will be locked.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling ads, suggestions and the MSN news feed in Microsoft Edge...

Features.Label: Microsoft Copilot
Features.ToolTip: This will disable and uninstall Microsoft Copilot, Windows' built-in AI assistant.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling Microsoft Copilot...

Features.Label: Windows Recall
Features.ToolTip: This will disable Windows Recall, an AI-powered feature that provides quick access to recently used files, apps and activities.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling Windows Recall...

Features.Label: Click To Do, AI text & image analysis
Features.ToolTip: This will disable Click To Do, which provides AI-powered text and image analysis features in Windows.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling Click to Do...

Features.Label: Xbox game/screen recording
Features.ToolTip: This will disable the Xbox game/screen recording features included with the Game Bar app.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling Xbox game/screen recording...

Features.Label: Game Bar integration
Features.ToolTip: This will disable the Game Bar integration with games and controllers. This stops annoying ms-gamebar popups when launching games or connecting a controller.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling Game Bar integration...

Features.Label: Remove all pinned apps from the start menu for this user only
Remove all pinned apps from the start menu for all existing and new users
Replace the start menu layout for this user only with the provided template file
Replace the start menu layout for all existing and new users with the provided template file
recommended section in the start menu
Features.ToolTip: This will hide the recommended section in the start menu, which shows recently added apps, recently opened files and app recommendations.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling the start menu recommended section...

Features.Label: Bing web search & Copilot integration
Features.ToolTip: This will turn off Bing web search results and Copilot integration in the Windows search experience.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling Bing web search & Copilot integration in Windows search...

Features.Label: Phone Link integration in the start menu
Features.ToolTip: This will remove the Phone Link integration in the start menu when you have a mobile device linked to your PC.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling the Phone Link mobile devices integration in the start menu...

Features.Label: Microsoft 365 Copilot ads in Settings Home
Features.ToolTip: This will turn off the Microsoft 365 Copilot ads that appear in the Settings Home page.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling Microsoft 365 Copilot ads in Settings Home...

Features.Label: Settings 'Home' page
Features.ToolTip: Removes the 'Home' page from the Settings app.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling the Settings Home page...

Features.Label: AI features in Microsoft Edge
Features.ToolTip: This will turn off AI features in Microsoft Edge, such as the AI-powered sidebar and Copilot features. This feature uses policies, some settings will be locked.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling AI features in Microsoft Edge...

Features.Label: AI features in Paint
Features.ToolTip: This will turn off AI features in Paint, such as the AI-powered image generation and editing tools.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling AI features in Paint...

Features.Label: AI features in Notepad
Features.ToolTip: This will turn off AI features in Notepad, such as the AI-powered writing suggestions.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling AI features in Notepad...

Features.Label: theme for system and apps
Features.ToolTip: This will set the app and system theme to dark mode.
Features.ApplyText: > Enabling dark mode for system and apps...

Features.Label: 'Drag Tray' for sharing & moving files
Features.ToolTip: The Drag Tray is a new feature for sharing & moving files in Windows 11, it appears at the top of the screen when dragging files.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling Drag Tray...

Features.Label: context menu style
Features.ToolTip: This will restore the classic Windows 10 style context menu instead of the modern Windows 11 style menu.
Features.ApplyText: > Restoring the classic Windows 10 style context menu...

Features.Label: Enhance Pointer Precision (mouse acceleration)
Features.ToolTip: This will disable mouse acceleration which is enabled by default in Windows. This makes mouse movement more consistent and predictable.
Features.ApplyText: > Turning off Enhanced Pointer Precision...

Features.Label: Sticky Keys keyboard shortcut (5x shift)
Features.ToolTip: This will prevent the Sticky Keys dialog from appearing when you press the Shift key 5 times in a row.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling the Sticky Keys keyboard shortcut...

Features.Label: window snapping
Features.ToolTip: This will turn off the ability to snap windows to the sides or corners of the screen.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling window snapping...

Features.Label: showing app suggestions when snapping windows
Features.ToolTip: This will turn off app suggestions when you snap windows to the sides or corners of the screen.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling the Snap Assist suggestions...

Features.Label: snap layout flyout at top of screen and on maximize button
Features.ToolTip: This will turn off the snap layout flyout that appears when you hover over the maximize button or drag windows to the top of the screen.
Features.ApplyText: > Hiding snap layouts when dragging windows to top of the screen and on maximize button...

Features.Label: tabs from apps when snapping or pressing Alt+Tab
Features.ApplyText: > Disable showing tabs from apps when snapping or pressing Alt+Tab...

Features.Label: tabs from apps when snapping or pressing Alt+Tab
Features.ApplyText: > Enable showing 3 tabs from apps when snapping or pressing Alt+Tab...

Features.Label: tabs from apps when snapping or pressing Alt+Tab
Features.ApplyText: > Enable showing 5 tabs from apps when snapping or pressing Alt+Tab...

Features.Label: tabs from apps when snapping or pressing Alt+Tab
Features.ApplyText: > Enable showing 20 tabs from apps when snapping or pressing Alt+Tab...

Features.Label: taskbar alignment
Features.ToolTip: By default, Windows 11 has the taskbar buttons centered. Enabling this setting will move the taskbar buttons to the left, similar to previous versions of Windows.
Features.ApplyText: > Aligning taskbar buttons to the left...

Features.Label: Hide search icon from the taskbar
Features.ApplyText: > Hiding the search icon from the taskbar...

Features.Label: Show search icon on the taskbar
Features.ApplyText: > Changing taskbar search to icon only...

Features.Label: Show search icon with label on the taskbar
Features.ApplyText: > Changing taskbar search to icon with label...

Features.Label: Show search box on the taskbar
Features.ApplyText: > Changing taskbar search to search box...

Features.Label: 'Task view' button on the taskbar
Features.ToolTip: This will disable the 'Task view' button on the taskbar, which allows you to see all your open windows and virtual desktops.
Features.ApplyText: > Hiding the taskview button from the taskbar...

Features.Label: widgets on the taskbar & lock screen
Features.ToolTip: This will disable the widgets features in Windows, including the widgets button on the taskbar and the widgets that can appear on the lock screen. This feature uses policies, some settings will be locked.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling widgets on the taskbar & lock screen...

Features.Label: Chat (meet now) icon on the taskbar
Features.ToolTip: This will disable the Chat (meet now) icon on the taskbar.
Features.ApplyText: > Hiding the chat icon from the taskbar...

Features.Label: fast start-up
Features.ToolTip: Fast Start-up helps your PC start faster after shutdown by saving a system image to disk. Disabling Fast Start-up can help with certain issues, but may result in slightly longer boot times.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling Fast Start-up...

Features.Label: BitLocker automatic device encryption
Features.ToolTip: For devices that support it, Windows 11 automatically enables BitLocker device encryption. Disabling this will turn off automatic encryption of the device, but you can still manually enable BitLocker encryption if desired.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling BitLocker automatic device encryption...

Features.Label: Modern Standby network connectivity
Features.ToolTip: By default, devices that support Modern Standby maintain network connectivity while in sleep mode. Disabling network connectivity during Modern Standby can help save battery life.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling network connectivity during Modern Standby...

Features.Label: 'End Task' option in taskbar context menu
Features.ToolTip: When enabled, adds an 'End Task' option to the right-click context menu for apps in the taskbar, allowing you to quickly force close apps.
Features.ApplyText: > Enabling the 'End Task' option in the taskbar right click menu...

Features.Label: 'Last Active Click' behavior for taskbar apps
Features.ToolTip: When enabled, clicking on an app in the taskbar will switch to the last active window of that app, instead of only showing the thumbnail preview.
Features.ApplyText: > Enabling the 'Last Active Click' behavior in the taskbar app area...

Features.Label: Always combine taskbar buttons and hide labels for the main display
Features.ApplyText: > Setting the taskbar on the main display to always combine buttons and hide labels...

Features.Label: Always combine taskbar buttons and hide labels for secondary displays
Features.ApplyText: > Setting the taskbar on secondary displays to always combine buttons and hide labels...

Features.Label: Combine taskbar buttons and hide labels when taskbar is full for the main display
Features.ApplyText: > Setting the taskbar on the main display to only combine buttons and hide labels when the taskbar is full...

Features.Label: Combine taskbar buttons and hide labels when taskbar is full for secondary displays
Features.ApplyText: > Setting the taskbar on secondary displays to only combine buttons and hide labels when the taskbar is full...

Features.Label: Never combine taskbar buttons and show labels for the main display
Features.ApplyText: > Setting the taskbar on the main display to never combine buttons or hide labels...

Features.Label: Never combine taskbar buttons and show labels for secondary displays
Features.ApplyText: > Setting the taskbar on secondary displays to never combine buttons or hide labels...

Features.Label: Show app icons on all taskbars
Features.ApplyText: > Setting the taskbar to show app icons on all taskbars...

Features.Label: Show app icons on main taskbar and on taskbar where the windows is open
Features.ApplyText: > Setting the taskbar to show app icons on main taskbar and on taskbar where the windows is open...

Features.Label: Show app icons only on taskbar where the window is open
Features.ApplyText: > Setting the taskbar to only show app icons on the taskbar where the window is open...

Features.Label: Change the default location that File Explorer opens to 'Home'
Features.ApplyText: > Changing the default location that File Explorer opens to, to 'Home'...

Features.Label: Change the default location that File Explorer opens to 'This PC'
Features.ApplyText: > Changing the default location that File Explorer opens to, to 'This PC'...

Features.Label: Change the default location that File Explorer opens to 'Downloads'
Features.ApplyText: > Changing the default location that File Explorer opens to, to 'Downloads'...

Features.Label: Change the default location that File Explorer opens to 'OneDrive'
Features.ApplyText: > Changing the default location that File Explorer opens to, to 'OneDrive'...

Features.Label: file extensions for known file types
Features.ToolTip: This will show file extensions for known file types. By default, Windows hides file extensions for known file types which can lead to confusion and security risks.
Features.ApplyText: > Enabling file extensions for known file types...

Features.Label: hidden files, folders and drives
Features.ToolTip: By default, Windows hides certain files, folders and drives to prevent accidental modification or deletion. Turn this on to show all files in File Explorer.
Features.ApplyText: > Unhiding hidden files, folders and drives...

Features.Label: 'Home' from navigation pane
Features.ToolTip: Hides the 'Home' section from the File Explorer navigation pane.
Features.ApplyText: > Hiding the home section from the File Explorer navigation pane...

Features.Label: 'Gallery' from navigation pane
Features.ToolTip: Hides the 'Gallery' section from the File Explorer navigation pane.
Features.ApplyText: > Hiding the gallery section from the File Explorer navigation pane...

Features.Label: duplicate removable drive entries
Features.ToolTip: By default, Windows shows removable drives both under 'This PC' and in the navigation pane with its own entry. Enable this setting to only show removable drives under 'This PC'.
Features.ApplyText: > Hiding duplicate removable drive entries from the File Explorer navigation pane...

Features.Label: common folders back to 'This PC' page
Features.ToolTip: This setting will add common folders like Desktop, Documents, Downloads, Music, Pictures and Videos back to the 'This PC' page in File Explorer.
Features.ApplyText: > Adding all common folders (Desktop, Downloads, etc.) back to 'This PC' in File Explorer...

Features.Label: transparency effects
Features.ToolTip: This will disable transparency effects on Windows and interfaces. Which can help improve performance on older hardware.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling transparency effects...

Features.Label: animations and visual effects
Features.ToolTip: This will disable animations and some visual effects in Windows, which can make the interface feel snappier, especially on older hardware.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling animations and visual effects...

Features.Label: updates as soon as they're available
Features.ToolTip: This will prevent your PC from being among the first to receive new non-security updates. Your PC will still receive these updates eventually.
Features.ApplyText: > Preventing Windows from getting updates as soon as they are available...

Features.Label: automatic restarts after updates while signed in
Features.ToolTip: This will prevent your PC from automatically restarting after updates while any user is signed in.
Features.ApplyText: > Preventing automatic restarts after updates while signed in...

Features.Label: sharing downloaded updates with other PCs
Features.ToolTip: This will prevent your PC from sharing downloaded updates with other PCs on the local network or on the internet. This also prevents your PC from downloading updates from other PCs.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling sharing of downloaded updates with other PCs...

Features.Label: Forcefully uninstall Microsoft Edge. NOT RECOMMENDED!
'Include in library' option in the context menu
Features.ToolTip: Hides the 'Include in library' option from the File Explorer context menu.
Features.ApplyText: > Hiding 'Include in library' in the context menu...

Features.Label: 'Give access to' option in the context menu
Features.ToolTip: Hides the 'Give access to' option from the File Explorer context menu.
Features.ApplyText: > Hiding 'Give access to' in the context menu...

Features.Label: 'Share' option in the context menu
Features.ToolTip: Hides the 'Share' option from the File Explorer context menu.
Features.ApplyText: > Hiding 'Share' in the context menu...

Features.Label: 'OneDrive' folder from navigation pane
Features.ToolTip: Hides the 'OneDrive' folder from the File Explorer navigation pane.
Features.ApplyText: > Hiding the OneDrive folder from the File Explorer navigation pane...

Features.Label: '3D objects' folder under 'This PC'
Features.ToolTip: Hides the '3D objects' folder from the File Explorer navigation pane.
Features.ApplyText: > Hiding the 3D objects folder from the File Explorer navigation pane...

Features.Label: 'Music' folder under 'This PC'
Features.ToolTip: Hides the 'Music' folder from the File Explorer navigation pane.
Features.ApplyText: > Hiding the music folder from the File Explorer navigation pane...

Features.Label: bloat in Brave browser (AI, Crypto, etc.)
Features.ToolTip: This will disable Brave's built-in AI features, Crypto wallet, News, Rewards, Talk and VPN.
Features.ApplyText: > Disabling Brave AI, Crypto, News, Rewards, Talk and VPN in Brave browser...

Features.Label: Windows Sandbox
Features.ToolTip: Windows Sandbox is a lightweight desktop environment for safely running applications in isolation. Software installed inside the Windows Sandbox environment remains 'sandboxed' and runs separately from the host machine. Only supported on Windows 11 Pro, Workstation, and Enterprise editions.
Features.ApplyText: > Enabling Windows Sandbox...

Features.Label: Windows Subsystem for Linux
Features.ToolTip: Windows Subsystem for Linux allows you to run a Linux environment directly on Windows without the need for a virtual machine.
Features.ApplyText: > Enabling Windows Subsystem for Linux...
